result.execSummary:
The defendant John O Chavez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid with payment plan on case 21CM726.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John O Chavez Jr

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:22 PM Defendant John O Chavez in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COSTS: $243; 

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Payment of Costs/Surcharges:  Defendant to pay $25/month commencing 10/01/2022 and each month thereafter or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:25 AM Defendant John O Chavez in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griffis requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

08:49 AM Defendant John O Chavez in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.
